title: 114_hr2829
content: The "Free Market Healthcare Restoration and Coverage Act of 2015" includes provisions such as repealing the individual and employer mandates, modifying premium assistance credits, ensuring freedom to maintain existing coverage, addressing essential health benefits, and repealing certain provisions of the PPACA and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010. The "Free Market Healthcare Restoration and Coverage Act of 2015" repeals the individual and employer mandates retroactively, along with modifying premium assistance credits. The "Free Market Healthcare Restoration and Coverage Act of 2015" repeals individual and employer mandates retroactively and modifies premium assistance credits for individuals not enrolled through state exchanges. The "Free Market Healthcare Restoration and Coverage Act of 2015" modifies premium assistance credits for individuals not previously enrolled in a qualified health plan through a state exchange established under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. Effective Date: The amendments made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013. SEC. 5. FREEDOM TO MAINTAIN EXISTING COVERAGE. Amends part 2 of subtitle C of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act by replacing section 1251 with a new section on the freedom to maintain existing coverage. No changes to existing coverage under group health plans or insurance coverage from date of enactment of the Act until December 31, 2017. This subtitle does not apply to plans or coverage during this period, regardless of renewal. Family members of individuals enrolled in a group health plan or insurance coverage from the date of enactment of the Act until December 31, 2017, can join the plan if allowed under its terms. New employees and their families can also enroll in the plan during this period, exempt from certain provisions of the Act. New employees and their families can enroll in a group health plan exempt from certain provisions of the Act if covered under collective bargaining agreements ratified before December 31, 2017. Coverage amendments to conform to new requirements will not terminate the agreements. The term 'grandfathered health' is defined in this title. The term 'grandfathered health plan' refers to any group health plan or health insurance coverage under collective bargaining agreements ratified before December 31, 2017. Amendments to conform to new requirements will not terminate the agreements, and the amendment will take effect as if included in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. SEC. 6 amends the essential health benefits package to include coverage required by states. SEC. 7 repeals provisions in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 are repealed effective May 31, 2017. The provisions of law amended or repealed by these acts are restored as if they had not been enacted. The budgetary effects of this Act will not be included in the PAYGO scorecard as per the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
